name: Beretta 92
description: A police officer's standard issue equipment.

name: .44 Magnum
description: A rimmed, large-bore cartridge originally designed for revolvers and quickly adopted for carbines and Rifle.

name: Glock 19
description: Ideal for a versatile role thanks to its reduced dimensions when compared to the standard sized option.

name: Colt M45A1
description: The M45A1 features durable Decobond™ brown coating and an M1913-spec Picatinny rail for mounting lights, lasers, and other accessories.

name: Colt M1911
description: A single-action, semi-automatic, magazine-fed, recoil-operated pistol chambered for the .45 ACP cartridge.

name: AAC Honey Badger
description: An integrally suppressed personal defense weapon based on the AR-15. It is chambered in .300 AAC Blackout and was originally produced by Advanced Armament Corporation (AAC).

name: AEK-971
description: The AEK-971 is based on previous AK Rifle in internal design and layout, but features a Balanced Automatics Recoil System (BARS) that enhances the traditional Kalashnikov long stroke gas piston operating system by reducing the negative effects of recoil.

name: Colt AR-15
description: A lightweight, magazine-fed, gas-operated semi-automatic rifle. It is a semi-automatic version of the M16 rifle sold for the civilian and law enforcement markets in the United States.

name: Barrett REC7
description: An American firearm manufactured as a selective-fire fully-automatic and semi-automatic rifle by Barrett Firearms.

name: FAMAE SAF
description: A blowback-operated select-fire submachine gun, firing from a closed bolt. It is based on the Swiss SIG SG 540 assault rifle which was produced under license in Chile in the 1980s.

name: HK P30L
description: A recent HK pistol design, the P30 is a modern police and security pistol that combines function and safety.

name: Staccato P
description: The Staccato P has never failed a law enforcement department evaluation, including drop, accuracy, reliability, and endurance testing.

name: Ruger American Rifle
description: Budget-level hunting/sporting bolt-action centerfire rifle made by Sturm, Ruger & Co.

name: Krag-Jørgensen
description: A repeating bolt-action rifle designed by the Norwegians Ole Herman Johannes Krag and Erik Jørgensen in the late 19th century.

name: Brügger & Thomet APC
description: Uses a straight blowback gas system. The addition of a proprietary hydraulic buffer system in the receiver back plate helps control recoil. More than 50% of the APC's parts are interchangeable between the different platforms.

name: Mossberg MVP
description: Newest addition to Mossberg's rifle line, it is meant to work with after-market AR magazines and is chambered in 5.56 NATO, versus standard .223 Remington, in order for customers to take advantage of surplus 5.56 NATO ammo which varies slightly from factory .223 Rem rounds.

name: AR-57
description: Also known as the AR Five Seven , the AR-57 is available as either an upper receiver for the AR-15/M16 rifle or a complete rifle, firing 5.7×28mm rounds from standard FN P90 magazines.

name: BR18
description: A bullpup assault rifle made by ST Kinetics of Singapore. It's barrel is coated with a proprietary dry lubricant which repels sand, dust, and gunpowder soot for easier maintenance. The rifle is also designed to be over the beach (OTB) capable, enabling the operator to safely fire after submerging the rifle in water.

name: Remington Model 700
description: A manually operated bolt action with two forward dual-opposed lugs. The bolt face is recessed, fully enclosing the base of the cartridge, the extractor is a C-clip sitting within the bolt face.

name: CS/LS06
description: A blowback-operated weapon chambered for the 9 × 19 mm cartridge. It fires from a closed bolt of a telescoped design, which wraps around the barrel. The weapon feeds ammunition from a 50-round helical magazine located at the top of the polymer receiver.

name: FN SCAR-H
description: The FN SCAR-H is chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO calibre and is available with barrels of various lengths (13” or 16”) . These barrels are interchangeable in less than 5 minutes.
